content.description:
Pitch 1:(WI3+, 50m): Start on the lower ramps where the ice tends to be brittle and thin. Work up through the steeper-than-it-looks couple of small ramps to a short (2m) wall. Up and over the wall, head right to a series of very easy (WI2) rolling bulges. Finish right to a small slinged cedar tree and a comfy belay. 
  
 Pitch 2 (WI2): Not worth the trouble usually, but climb the rolling bumps until you get bored. 
  
 Descent: Rap the route.

Located 3.6km down Mile 38 Road. This route is located in the fairly prominent saddle. An identifying landmark is a square-sided, 2-meter-wide rock chute that is immediately to the left of the route.
Screws.

Just to the right of Dutch Treat is a left-facing dihedral. In good seasons the corner fills with ice, offering some interesting climbing. Ascend the pillars, all the while leaning on the dihedral when the ice is narrow. Clip the bolt on the right side, and then maneuver left, ascending the thin ice past two more bolts and a slinged birch tree, to a ledge (of sorts). Continue up the corner with several short pillars to the larger trees above and the slinged pine tree. Off of Mile 38 road, a couple km from 17.

To the left of the road there is a cliff line and behind a rather large pond is winding trail to the climb.

There are some marked trees that lead to the base. During the summer (I assume) there are some rock climbs for both sport and trad.

In the winter, trad for sure. There are some bolts that appear out of the ice.

Start up a lichen-filled corner with good hands/feet about 15 feet to a bolt. Make one reachy 5.9 move to a pinch. Afterward, the angle eases way back. Hike past one more bolt on your right and scramble/walk the remainder of the route to the top of the formation.

River Bend Rock is near kilometer 10 on Mile 38 rd. There is flagging tape and spray paint on the trees to mark the access trail. The first marked trail goes to Oxbow Wall and the second a little farther down leads to Sara's Slabs, Yukon's Wall, and the Animal View Walls. The Animal View wall is split into a Lower and Upper section. Climb one of the pitches on the Lower Animal View Wall to reach the base of the route, or hike around from the base of the formation to the top of the wall and rappel in (just under 30m rappel - knot those ropes!). Mole's Move is on the right ride of the Animal View Upper Wall at the most vertical part of the cliff. The first bolt is visible about 15 feet up.
2 bolts, 2 bolt anchor

pathTokens: LAKE SUPERIOR E: Sault St. Marie to Marathon, includes Montreal River Harbor and Agawa Canyon

content.description: Very accessible area down a plowed road
